docs.snippet: World Cup security guards who are assigned to maintain order inside the throbbing stadiums must keep their eyes firmly locked on the stands, and not the soccer....
docs.lead_paragraph: World Cup security guards who are assigned to maintain order inside the throbbing stadiums must keep their eyes firmly locked on the stands, and not the soccer.
docs.abstract: Security guards working World Cup matches are required to stand within shouting distance of the games but are not allowed to watch the games at all; should Brazil win its sixth World Cup in July, guards at the stadium may be the only two dozen people in the country not watching.

headline.seo: World Cup Security Is Near Soccer History, but Can’t See It
headline.main: Soccer Fans’ Dream Job Has a Catch: No Peeking
headline.print_headline: Soccer Fans’ Dream Job Has a Catch: No Peeking

byline.contributor: Andrew Keh reported from Fortaleza, Brazil, and Sergio Peçanha from Natal.
byline.original: By ANDREW KEH and SERGIO PEÇANHA

docs.snippet: Jon Beason, who became one of the Giants’ defensive leaders late last season, will not need surgery to correct the ligament tear and small fracture in his right foot sustained last week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jon Beason, who became one of the Giants’ defensive leaders late last season, will not need surgery to correct the ligament tear and small fracture in his right foot sustained last week.
docs.abstract: New York Giants middle linebacker Jon Beason will not require surgery to correct foot injury.

headline.main: Giants’ Beason Avoids Surgery, but Status for Opener Is in Doubt

docs.snippet: Shocked by a suicide bombing attack against a World Cup viewing site in northeast Nigeria, the country's national team is more determined than ever to succeed in Brazil and provide some comfort to those at home, a team official said on Wednesday....
